tool.name: Faster Download and Extract Reads in FASTQ

param.name: minlen
param.label: Minimum read length
param.help: Filter by sequence length. Will dump only reads longer or equal to this value.

param.name: split
param.label: Select how to split the spots
param.help: This option will only be used when there are multiple reads per spot (for example paired-end).
param.option: --split-3: write properly paired biological reads into different files and single reads in another file
--split-files: write reads into different files (forward and reverse may not match if one read is empty)
--split-spot: split spots into reads (only one output file)
--concatenate-reads: writes whole spots into one file

param.name: skip_technical
param.label: Dump only biological reads
param.help: Will not be used if --split-3 is selected.

tool.help:
**What it does?**
This tool extracts data (in fastq_ format) from the Short Read Archive (SRA) at the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI). It is based on the fasterq-dump_ utility of the SRA Toolkit. The following applies:
- if data is paired-ended (or mate-pair) the tool will generate a collection of file pairs, in which each element will be a pair of fastq_ files containing forward and reverse mates. - if data is single ended, each element of the collection will be a single fastq_ dataset.
@HOW_TO_USE_IT@
-----
**Output**
In every case, fastq datasets produced will be saved in Galaxy's history as a collection_ - a single history element containing multiple datasets. In fact, regardless of the experimental design, three collections will be produced: one containing paired-end data, another containing single-end data, and a third one which contains reads which could not be classified. Some collections may be empty if the accessions provided in the list do not contain one of the type of data.
.. class:: warningmark
When you decide to dump technical reads (in Advanced Options Dump only biological reads is set to No), you will probably find your PAIRED data in the other data collection as it is impossible to determine if it was 2 biological reads or one biological and one technical.
.. class:: warningmark
By default, only biological reads are dumped and in case of PAIRED dataset only the spots which have both reads will be in the paired-end collection. The remaining single reads will be in the other colletion. To keep all reads, and potentially not have the same number of reads in forward and reverse use the --split-files option in Advanced Options, Select how to split the spots.
@ACCESSION_LIST_HOWTO@
-----
